Description:
STATE OF VERMONT OFFICE OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, DEPARTMENT FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, VERMONT WEATHERIZATION 
TRAINING CENTER

THE VERMONT OFFICE OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY (OEO) WILL PLAN AND LAUNCH A WEATHERIZATION TRAINING CENTER TO 
DIVERSIFY AND GROW THE WEATHERIZATION WORKFORCE NEEDED TO ACHIEVE THE STATE’S GOAL OF WEATHERIZING 120,000 HOMES 
BY 2030.

LA CASA DE DON PEDRO, ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND GREEN JOB TRAINING PROGRAM WILL SUPPORT WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND CREATE PATHWAYS TO CAREERS IN THE HOME PERFORMANCE, ENERGY EFFICIENCY, AND RENEWABLE ENERGY SECTORS BY RECRUITING, HIRING AND RETAINING INDIVIDUALS CURRENTLY UNDERREPRESENTED IN THESE INDUSTRIES. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED IN PART BY UTILIZING OUR EXISTING WEATHERIZATION, CLEAN ENERGY JOBS TRAINING, AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT RESOURCES AND EXPERIENCE.

ELECTRIFYING NEW YORK’S AFFORDABLE HOUSING

THE GOAL IS TO DEVELOP, AND IMPLEMENT, A PROTOCOL TO ENSURE THAT RESIDENTS IN MULTIFAMILY BUILDINGS WHO CAN MOST BENEFIT FROM ELECTRIFICATION AND WEATHERIZATION ARE PRIORITIZED TO RECEIVE THOSE SERVICES, ENABLING THIS SECTOR TO MEET THE CITY AND STATE’S AMBITIOUS CLIMATE GOALS.

OREGON WEATHERIZATION WORKFORCE DIVERSIFICATION AND EXPANSION PROJECT

THE OREGON WEATHERIZATION WORKFORCE DIVERSIFICATION AND EXPANSION PROJECT (OWWDEP) IS A MULTI-TIERED PROJECT THAT USES RELATIONSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS AND PRIVATE INDUSTRY TO DEFINE AND PROVIDE AN ADVANCEMENT STRUCTURE FOR ENERGY CONSERVATION WORK IN OREGON. OWWDEP WILL:
1. ASSESS THE PERSONNEL NEEDS IN THE INDUSTRY, FOCUSING ON REMOVING BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT AND IMPEDIMENTS IN CAREER ADVANCEMENT; BASED ON ASSESSMENT, DEVELOP A PAID INTERNSHIP STRUCTURE; IMPLEMENT SHIFTS IN INSTRUCTIONAL DELIVERY AND ASSESSMENT TO BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR INDUSTRY, FOCUSING ON CHANGES THAT MAKE LEARNING OUTCOMES MORE ACCESSIBLE AND CONTENT AND QUALIFICATIONS MORE TRANSFERRABLE AMONGST PREVIOUSLY SILOED CERTIFICATIONS; AND, APPLY INSTRUCTIONAL SHIFTS AND EMPLOY AN ADVANCEMENT STRUCTURE BASED ON AN INNOVATIVE “FRONT-LOADED” AND PRE-QUALIFIED RECRUITMENT STRUCTURE. THIS STRUCTURE LEVERAGES RELATIONSHIPS WITH CONTRACTORS AND THE EXISTING STRUCTURE OF QUALITY CONTROL FOR WEATHERIZATION WORK TO CREATE AN INTEGRATED VETTING PROCESS.

RURAL ALASKA COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM INC (RURAL CAP), WEATHERIZATION SUPPORT PROJECT

UNDER THE SINGLE-FAMILY AND MANUFACTURED HOUSING TOPIC AREA, THE RURAL ALASKA COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM, INC., (RURAL CAP) WEATHERIZATION (WX) TEAM WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF HOMES RECEIVING COMPREHENSIVE, INNOVATIVE DEEP ENERGY RETROFITS WHILE ALSO REDUCING CLIENTS’ ENERGY BURDEN. THIS WILL IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH AND SAFETY BY BRINGING HOMES OFF DEFERRAL/WAITLISTS AND INTO THE WEATHERIZATION PIPELINE, SERVING 100% ALASKA NATIVE FAMILIES WITH LOW AND VERY-LOW- INCOMES IN RURAL ALASKAN COMMUNITIES. SELECTED COMMUNITIES ARE SEVERELY UNDERSERVED AND HAVE NOT RECEIVED WEATHERIZATION SERVICES FOR OVER 20 YEARS. THE OUTCOMES OF THIS WORK WILL INCLUDE DEEP ENERGY RETROFITS OF 45 HOMES, HOME IMPROVEMENT EDUCATION FOR 45 CLIENTS, AND THE INCORPORATION OF INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGIES SUCH AS ENERGY RECOVERY VENTILATORS (ERV) AND AIR-TO- AIR HEAT PUMPS AS A REPLICABLE PRACTICE IN THE NORTHERN MOST CLIMATE REGION.

UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT URBANA-CHAMPAIGN, REDUCING DEFERRALS BY INTEGRATING HEALTHY HOMES WITH 
WEATHERIZATION

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ESTABLISH A SYSTEMATIC APPROACH TO REDUCE DEFERRALS AND WEATHERIZE MORE HOMES BY 
INTEGRATING HEALTHY HOME EVALUATIONS WITH TRADITIONAL ENERGY AUDITS.
SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDE:
•	INTEGRATE A HEALTHY HOME EVALUATION TOOL WITH A STANDARD WAP ENERGY AUDIT (YEAR 1)
•	THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH SUBGRANTEES, EVALUATE, WEATHERIZE, AND MONITOR A SAMPLE OF HOMES THAT WOULD 
OTHERWISE BE DEFERRED (YEAR 1-3)
•	DEVELOP COST-BENEFIT CALCULATIONS, INCLUDING ESTIMATES OF HEALTH-RELATED BENEFITS (YEAR 3)
•	PRODUCE A SCALABLE FRAMEWORK FOR INTEGRATING HEALTHY HOME EVALUATIONS WITH STANDARD ENERGY AUDITS THAT CAN 
BE ADOPTED NATIONALLY WITHIN WAP (YEAR 3)
•	DEVELOP RELEVANT TECHNICAL, POLICY, AND ADMINISTRATIVE TRAINING (YEAR 3)
•	HELP AND SERVE HISTORICALLY DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.

IMPACT COMMUNITY ACTION, OHIO’S FIRST NET ZERO NEIGHBORHOOD: AMERICAN ADDITION

THE PROJECT TEAM WILL ADDRESS THE PLACE- BASED INITIATIVES TOPIC AREA AND OUR PROPOSAL IS TO WORK WITH THE COMMUNITY TO PROVIDE DEEP ENERGY RETROFITS FOR THE 60 HISTORIC HOMES IN AMERICAN ADDITION TO ENSURE THE HIGHEST EFFICIENCY STANDARDS, PREPARE HOMES FOR ELECTRIFICATION AND WEATHERIZATION, AND READY THEM FOR INSTALLATION OF ON-SITE RENEWABLE ENERGY.

EMERALD CITIES COLLABORATIVE, EMERALD CONNECTIONS: COMMUNITY CENTERED WEATHERIZATION + HEALTH

THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DELIVER 120 DEEP ENERGY RETROFITS TO JUSTICE40 COMMUNITIES BY EMPLOYING 
DEEP COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT STRATEGIES IN WA AND MA. WE DEFINE DEEP ENERGY RETROFITS WITHIN THE CONTEXT OF THIS 
PROJECT TO INCLUDE CLIMATE AND HEALTH MITIGATION STRATEGIES AS WELL. WE KNOW THAT SOME OF THE LARGEST BARRIERS TO 
IMPLEMENTING WEATHERIZATION INCLUDE HEALTH AND SAFETY BARRIERS. BY MITIGATING THESE BARRIERS WE CAN IMPLEMENT 
WAP PROJECTS THEREBY REDUCING ENERGY BURDEN AND IMPROVING CLIMATE RESILIENCY.

PREPARING THE FRONTLINES FOR A CLIMATE FUTURE THROUGH HOLISTIC WEATHERIZATION

SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE ELIGIBILITY AND UPTAKE OF LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS FULLY PARTICIPATING IN THE WAP, THEREBY REDUCING ENERGY BURDEN AND MAKING THE RESIDENCE CLIMATE READY. TO DO THIS WE MUST HELP RESIDENTS OVERCOME BARRIERS TO PROGRAM AWARENESS, TAX ASSESSMENT CONCERNS, TITLE CONCERNS AND HOME REPAIR. OUR COMBINED EFFORTS OF CO-PRODUCTION, AGENCY COORDINATION, AND AN ONLINE WEATHERIZATION COORDINATION PLATFORM (WCP) WILL LIMIT ATTRITION AND INCREASE OVERALL WEATHERIZATION ACTIVITY.

PHILADELPHIA GREEN CAPITAL CORP., BUILT TO LAST: RESTORING SAFE, HEALTHY, AFFORDABLE HOMES

THE BUILT TO LAST (BTL) INITIATIVE BUILDS A SCALABLE, REPLICABLE SET OF TOOLS TO COMPLETE HOLISTIC HOME REPAIRS FOR LOW-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS IN UNDERSERVED AND HISTORICALLY MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES. BUILT TO LAST PROVIDES A POWERFUL BACKBONE THAT IMPROVES THE EFFICACY OF THE EXISTING WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM TO LAYER, COORDINATE, AND SUPPLEMENT HOME REPAIR PROGRAMS THAT ACHIEVE ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND WEATHERIZATION, HEALTH AND SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS THAT ADDRESS SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH, CLIMATE RESILIENCE, AND PRESERVATION AND STABILIZATION OF EXISTING AFFORDABLE HOUSING.

THE WAP RECRUITMENT CAMPAIGN, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND CONTRACTOR SUPPORT WILL RAISE AWARENESS OF AND INTEREST IN WAP CAREERS AND CONTRACT WORK WITH DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS AND MINORITY- AND WOMEN-OWNED BUSINESSES. IT WILL ALSO RESULT IN SUBGRANTEE ADOPTION OF MORE EFFECTIVE RECRUITMENT PRACTICES.

THE ELECTRIFY MONTEREY BAY PROJECT’S OBJECTIVE IS TO PROVIDE WHOLE-HOUSE ELECTRIFICATION, ENERGY EFFICIENCY, AND HEALTH AND SAFETY (H&S) REMEDIATION TO LOW-INCOME, HIGH ENERGY BURDEN HOUSEHOLDS AND SERVE AS A PILOT PROGRAM TO PROVIDE MODELED HOMES FOR FUTURE CASE STUDIES ON THE CLIMATE AND H&S BENEFITS OF ELECTRIFICATION. CCES WILL ACCOMPLISH THE GOAL BY INITIALLY TREATING LIHEAP AND/OR DOE DEFERRED HOMES AND EXPECTS TO ELECTRIFY AT LEAST 50 HOUSEHOLDS IN ORDER TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND CONTRIBUTE TO STATE AND FEDERAL CARBON REDUCTION GOALS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUCCESSFULLY DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A PILOT PROGRAM DEMONSTRATING AN EQUITY-FOCUSED PATHWAY FOR DECARBONIZATION OF LOW-INCOME RESIDENTIAL HOMES, WHILE GATHERING KNOWLEDGE AND DATA AS PROOF OF CONCEPT WHEN SEEKING LEVERAGED FUNDING. BY TARGETING MAJOR ROOFING AND ELECTRICAL IN-HOME CHALLENGES, THE WIRE ACCESS PROJECT WILL ALLOW THESE HOMES TO BE BROUGHT INTO THE QUEUE FOR DEEP-ENERGY RETROFITS, INCLUDING SOLAR ENERGY AND ELECTRIFICATION. THE EQUITY-FOCUS OF THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE APPLICATION OF AN EQUITY LENS THROUGH-OUT THE PROJECT DURING OUTREACH, ENGAGEMENT TO STAKEHOLDERS TO SEEK INPUT, IN DESIGN OF THE PROGRAM TO MEET COMMUNITY NEEDS AS DELINEATED BY THE COMMUNITIES SERVED, DURING DEVELOPMENT OF THE PROGRAM POLICY AND IMPLEMENTATION PROCEDURES, IN EFFORTS TO EXPAND JOB-CREATION AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES AMONGST THE COMMUNITIES SERVED, AND IN TARGETING OF HOUSEHOLDS TO SERVE.

THE END GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE RETROFITS TO 3-5 MULTI-FAMILY AFFORDABLE HOUSING PROPERTIES SERVING LOW-INCOME TENANTS FOR 50 OR MORE YEARS. THE MAIN FOCUS WILL BE ON CAPITAL INVESTMENTS THAT SUPPORT DECARBONIZATION MEASURES SUCH AS CONVERTING THE PROPERTIES’ HEATING, HOT WATER, VENTILATION AND/OR APPLIANCES FROM GAS TO MORE EFFICIENT ELECTRIC SYSTEMS. ADDITIONALLY, CAPITAL INVESTMENTS WILL SUPPORT OTHER HEALTH AND SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS TO BENEFIT TENANTS AND TRADITIONAL ENERGY EFFICIENCY MEASURES. ADDITIONALLY, THE GOAL IS TO REDUCE TENANTS’ ENERGY BURDEN BY ENSURING THAT ALL TENANTS IN THE DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS LEVERAGE THE CITY OF SEATTLE’S UTILITY DISCOUNT PROGRAM WHICH PROVIDES A 60% DISCOUNT ON TENANTS’ ELECTRIC BILLS, FOR CUSTOMERS EARNING 70% OF STATE MEDIAN INCOME. FINALLY, THE GOAL IS TO ADVANCE A MORE INCLUSIVE APPROACH TO EVALUATING COST-EFFECTIVENESS BY RECOMMENDING HOW TO INCLUDE NON-ENERGY BENEFITS AND THE SOCIAL COST OF CARBON ASSOCIATED WITH THESE DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PERFORM DEEP ENERGY RETROFITS, CARBON REDUCTION AND ELECTRIFICATION ON 30 HOMES 
ON NATIVE RESERVATIONS IN PINE RIDGE. THIS PROJECT SPECIFICALLY ADDRESSES THE CHALLENGES AND WEATHERIZATION 
INNOVATIONS REQUIRED TO ACHIEVE THESE RESULTS FOR CLIENTS LIVING IN AN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY (96% ENERGY BURDEN 
IN DOE’S DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES REPORTER (DCR) - WITH SUBSTANDARD HOUSING (95% MOBILE HOME IN DCR)). 
A MINIMUM 50 PERCENT REDUCTION IN ENERGY CONSUMPTION (AS MEASURED IN SITE BTUS) IS TARGETED FOR ALL HOMES. 
THE DEVELOPMENT AND APPLICATION OF A CATALOGUE OF MEASURES AND APPROACHES AND A CORRESPONDING CRITERION FOR 
SELECTION OF APPLICABLE MEASURES WILL BE USED TO ACHIEVE THE ASSOCIATED ENERGY REDUCTION AS WELL AS ON-SITE 
PHOTOVOLTAICS, RENEWABLE TECHNOLOGIES AND ELECTRIFICATION. THIS PROJECT WILL EMPLOY ACCEPTED BUILDING SCIENCE 
MEASURES IN A SYNERGISTIC COMBINATION TO ACHIEVE THE DESIRED RESULTS IN A COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER TO AN 
UNDERSERVED POPULATION AND WITH DIRECT SERVICES DELIVERED BY A NATIVE AMERICAN WORKFORCE TRAINED SPECIFICALLY FOR 
DOE ENHANCED WEATHERIZATION.

HEALTHY HOMES INITIATIVE (HHI) IN MARICOPA COUNTY
PROJECT GOALS: THE HHI’S GOALS ARE TO: 1. ELIMINATE HEALTH AND SAFETY HAZARDS FOR MEDICARE AND MEDICAID RECIPIENTS WITH CHRONIC CONDITIONS WHOSE HOUSING AND HOME HAZARDS CONTRIBUTE TO POOR HEALTH OUTCOMES; 2. ALIGN WORK WITH CURRENT PROGRAMS TO ELIMINATE DUPLICATION AND TO ENSURE WHOLE HOUSE APPROACH (WAP, LIHEAP, LOW-INCOME UTILITY PROGRAM); 3. VALIDATE HEALTH CARE COST SAVINGS; 4. DISSEMINATE PROOF-OF-CONCEPT FOR REPLICATION ACROSS THE U.S., AND 5.IDENTIFY POTENTIAL SUSTAINABLE FUNDING MECHANISMS FOR NON-ENERGY HEALTH-RELATED MEASURES.
FSLHI PROPOSES TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OUTCOMES OF A MINIMUM OF 100 HOUSEHOLDS THAT ARE ELIGIBLE AND HAVE REQUESTED WAP. UNDERSERVED HOUSEHOLDS OF MEDICAID-INSURED INDIVIDUALS WITH CHRONIC CONDITIONS WHOSE HOME ENVIRONMENTS EXACERBATE THEIR MEDICAL CONDITIONS ARE THE TARGET POPULATION. THE HHI WILL REMEDIATE HEALTH AND SAFETY HAZARDS WHILE LEVERAGING COMMITTED FUNDING TO COMPLETE WAP IN THE HOMES. IN ADDITION TO COLLABORATIONS WITH EXISTING WAP AGENCIES, FSLHI WILL PARTNER WITH MERCY CARE, AN ARIZONA MEDICAID INSURER, AND THREE3 INC., A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION WITH EXPERTISE IN EVALUATION AND SOCIAL SCIENCE RESEARCH, TO ANALYZE PRE-/POST INTERVENTION HEALTH AND CLAIMS DATA AND PRE-/-POST CLIENT SURVEY RESPONSES TO CALCULATE THE FINANCIAL IMPACT OF THE INITIATIVE AS WELL PROJECTED QUALITY OF LIFE OUTCOMES. FSLHI AND THREE3 WILL PUBLISH THE PILOT’S OUTCOMES AND IDENTIFY POTENTIAL FUNDING SOURCES IN ORDER FOR WAP ORGANIZATIONS AND THEIR PARTNERS TO REPLICATE THIS PROGRAM THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY.

THIS PROJECT OFFERS A COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH FOR PROGRAM DELIVERY TO ADDRESS HEALTH AND SAFETY BARRIERS, WEATHERIZATION, ELECTRIFICATION, AND RENEWABLE ENERGY IN A “ONE STOP SHOP” PROGRAM FOR ELIGIBLE HOUSEHOLDS. OUR APPROACH PAIRS BUILDING WEATHERIZATION AS ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE WAP PROVIDERS WITH ELECTRIFICATION MEASURES, LEADING TO AN APPROACH FOR EQUITABLE MULTIFAMILY BUILDING DECARBONIZATION. LEVERAGING PHILANTHROPIC AND UTILITY FUNDING, IN ADDITION TO WAP ASSISTANCE, THE PROJECT TEAM WILL DELIVER RETROFITS TO AT LEAST 675 LOW-INCOME MULTIFAMILY UNITS IN COOK COUNTY (IL) AND DANE COUNTY (WI), WHILE CREATING JOB OPPORTUNITIES FOR BIPOC WORKERS AND CONTRACTORS. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CEDA AND PROJECT HOME, ELEVATE WILL ESTABLISH THE METHODOLOGY FOR A JOINT WEATHERIZATION AND ELECTRIFICATION (WX+E) PROGRAM. THIS PROJECT IS AN OPPORTUNITY TO DEVELOP A SCALABLE MODEL FOR AFFORDABLE HOUSING RETROFITS IN SUPPORT OF THE JUSTICE40 INITIATIVE, DELIVERING THE BENEFITS OF CLIMATE AND CLEAN ENERGY INVESTMENTS TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

THE TOLEDO HEALTHY HOMES TRAINING CENTER (THHTC) WILL SERVE AS A REGIONAL HUB TO PROVIDE THE TRAINING NEEDS OF WAP PROVIDERS IN NORTHERN OHIO, AS WELL AS FOR THE LOCAL CONTRACTORS USED BY THOSE PROGRAMS. THE THHTC WILL OFFER TRAINEES AN ENTRY WAY TO THE BROADER CLEAN ENERGY JOB MARKET AND EXPAND THE WAP WORKFORCE CAPACITY ACROSS NORTHERN OHIO (AND POSSIBLY STATEWIDE). THE THHTC WILL FACILITATE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES ACROSS IMPACTED COMMUNITIES UTILIZING GREEN AND HEALTHY HOMES INITIATIVE (GHHI)’S PROVEN INTEGRATED SERVICE MODEL FOR HEALTHY AND ENERGY EFFICIENT HOUSING INTERVENTIONS: WEATHERIZATION, LEAD REMEDIATION, AIR QUALITY, ETC. THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES WILL BE MET BY THIS PROGRAM:
• IDENTIFICATION OF A FACILITY FOR TRAINING PER OHIO MINIMUM WEATHERIZATION STANDARDS AND FEDERAL AND STATE LEAD HAZARD MITIGATION GUIDELINES, AS WELL AS ADDITIONAL HEALTHY HOMES SUBJECT MATTER AS PARTNERS DEEM APPROPRIATE AND ADDITIONAL FUNDING IS BRAIDED.
• RENOVATION OF THE FACILITIES AS NECESSARY TO MEET THE REQUIREMENTS FOR A COAD HUB, AS WELL AS A CERTIFIED BPI TRAINING AND TESTING FACILITY.
• SECURING WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT RESOURCES TO PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE RESOURCES LIKE FINANCIAL EDUCATION, STIPENDS, TRANSPORTATION VOUCHERS, AND LICENSING FEES.
• RECRUITMENT, TRAINING AND MENTORING A DIVERSE WORKFORCE, INCLUDING LICENSED MINORITY CONTRACTORS, WILL INCREASE THEIR CAPACITY TO COMPETE FOR WEATHERIZATION AND LEAD MITIGATION JOBS, BOTH AS DIRECT EMPLOYEES OR AS CONTRACTORS WORKING FOR WAP PROVIDERS.
BY DELIVERING THIS SUPPORT IN A CONVENIENT, CULTURALLY COMPETENT NEIGHBORHOOD SETTING, NHST AIMS TO PUT JOB-SEEKERS ON A “FAST-TRACK” TO BOOSTING THEIR BASIC SKILLS AND MOVING INTO HIGHER-LEVEL TRAINING AND JOB PLACEMENT FOR MIDDLE-SKILLS CAREER PATHWAYS.

COMMUNITY RELATIONS-SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION (SDC), ONE OF THE LARGEST WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM PROVIDERS, IS COMMITTED TO SUPPORT THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY IN ITS EFFORTS TO ACHIEVE CARBON POLLUTION-FREE ELECTRICITY BY 2035 AND ESTABLISH A PATHWAY TO NET-ZERO EMISSIONS BY 2050. THE WAP ENHANCEMENT FOR MILWAUKEE HOMES PROJECT IS A COLLABORATIVE EFFORT AMONG HOUSING, ENERGY, AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS WHO OPERATE IN THE CITY OF MILWAUKEE, WISCONSIN.

THIS PROJECT WILL TARGET NEIGHBORHOODS WITH EXCESSIVELY HIGH ENERGY BURDENS IN AREAS THAT ARE ALSO PREDOMINATELY OCCUPIED BY LOW-INCOME AND BIPOC POPULATIONS WHO HAVE INEQUITABLE ACCESS TO THE RESOURCES NEEDED TO MAKE HOUSING UNITS INTO AFFORDABLE, ENERGY EFFICIENT, AND HEALTHY PLACES TO LIVE. SDC STRESSES AND ENSURES THAT THE PROJECT’S DEMOGRAPHICS AGREE AND ARE EQUIVALENT TO THE DEMOGRAPHICS OF THE TARGETED AREAS THAT HAVE A HIGH ENERGY BURDEN AND THE HIGHEST POVERTY RATES. SDC WILL USE DATA FROM THE US CENSUS AND DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY TO ENSURE THAT THE SELECTED HOUSING UNITS REPRESENT: 1) THE TARGETED AREA’S DEMOGRAPHICS; 2) THE UNITS WITH THE HIGHEST ENERGY BURDEN; AND 3) HOUSEHOLDS WITH INCOMES BELOW FEDERAL POVERTY LEVELS. SDC WILL ALSO ADVOCATE FOR DEMOGRAPHICS WHO HAVE HISTORICALLY BEEN MARGINALIZED IN THE TARGETED NEIGHBORHOODS. THESE NEIGHBORHOODS TEND TO HAVE THE HIGHEST ENERGY BURDENS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF ATHENS ENERGY OPPORTUNITY IS TO EXPAND THE REACH OF WEATHERIZATION AND ADDRESS STRUCTURAL BARRIERS TO LOW-INCOME AND HISTORICALLY DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES* IN ACCESSING ENERGY EFFICIENCY, WEATHERIZATION, AND RENEWABLE ENERGY BENEFITS THAT HAVE HISTORICALLY BENEFITTED WEALTHIER COMMUNITIES IN AN INEQUITABLE WAY. BY PURSUING THIS EFFORT IN CONJUNCTION WITH HOLISTIC COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, IMPACTED COMMUNITIES WILL BE POISED
TO TAKE OWNERSHIP OF AND LEADERSHIP IN THE DIRECTION OF CURRENT AND FUTURE OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPLEMENT ENERGY EFFICIENCY, WEATHERIZATION, RENEWABLE ENERGY, AND OTHER SERVICES IN THEIR COMMUNITY. WORKING WITH YOUTH WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMMING, THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THESE COMMUNITY IMPROVEMENTS WILL OPEN PATHWAYS TO HIGH-DEMAND AND LUCRATIVE CAREERS FOR IMPACTED YOUTH IN THE FIELD OF SUSTAINABLE BUILDING, ENERGY EFFICIENCY, AND SOLAR ENERGY.

PHILADELPHIA ENERGY AUTHORITY, BUILT TO LAST PROJECT

PEA DEVELOPED A HOME IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM CALLED BUILT TO LAST THAT INTEGRATES AND WEAVES TOGETHER FUNDING FROM EXISTING HOUSING REPAIR PROGRAMS TO REDUCE THEIR DEFERRAL RATES WHILE HOLISTICALLY RESTORING EXISTING LOW-INCOME HOMES. IN ADDITION TO REESTABLISHING THE HOMES AS SECURE, HEALTHY AND AFFORDABLE PLACES TO LIVE, THE BUILT TO LAST MODEL MAKES THE HOMES RESILIENT: HOMES RESTORED THROUGH THE PROGRAM ARE LESS SUSCEPTIBLE TO THE EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE AND UNCERTAIN ENERGY MARKETS BECAUSE THEIR STRUCTURES ARE STABLE, BASIC SERVICES SUCH AS HEATING AND PLUMBING ARE FUNCTIONAL, THEY ARE PROTECTED FROM THE ELEMENTS, AND ULTIMATELY OPERATE MORE EFFICIENTLY. HOMES IN THIS PROGRAM ALSO BENEFIT FROM AIR-CONDITIONING AND ROOFTOP SOLAR SYSTEMS INSTALLATIONS WHENEVER POSSIBLE.

THE PURPOSE OF THE WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE THE ENERGY EFFICIENCY OF DWELLINGS OWNED AND OCCUPIED BY LOW-INCOME PERSONS, REDUCE THEIR TOTAL RESIDENTIAL EXPENDITURES, AND IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH AND SAFETY. THE PRIORITY POPULATION FOR THE WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS PERSONS WHO ARE PARTICULARLY VULNERABLE SUCH AS THE ELDERLY, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES, FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN, HIGH RESIDENTIAL ENERGY USERS, AND HOUSEHOLDS WITH HIGH-ENERGY BURDEN.

OCCUPIED BY LOW-INCOME PERSONS, REDUCE THEIR TOTAL RESIDENTIAL EXPENDITURES, AND IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH AND SAFETY. 
THE PRIORITY POPULATION FOR THE WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS PERSONS WHO ARE PARTICULARLY VULNERABLE SUCH 
AS THE ELDERLY, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES, FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN, HIGH RESIDENTIAL ENERGY USERS, AND HOUSEHOLDS WITH 
HIGH-ENERGY BURDEN.
